description: From Late Latin perfervidus, from Latin per- + fervidus. Surface analysis per- +‎ fervid; compare pellucid.

adjectives.description: perfervid (comparative more perfervid, superlative most perfervid)

entries.meaning: Extremely, excessively, or feverishly passionate; zealous.
examples: Manders — perfervid — 'hell'-ing excitedly (was there no one left on earth to convert but me?), quoting over a century from Marx and Nietzsche to Lenin, Lloyd George, and Eden, and on to Vessant and Mundaine and himself...
